Sentencas: Perovskite type SrCo0.9Ta0.1O3-d (SCT10) is a promising cathode for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC), but its stability towards Cr impurities is not yet exploited.
Titulo: Cr deposition and poisoning on SrCo0.9Ta0.1O3-d cathode of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, the Cr deposition on the electrochemical performance of SCT10 cathodes is evaluated at 700 degrees C with a cathodic constant current density of 200 mA cm-2.
Titulo: Cr deposition and poisoning on SrCo0.9Ta0.1O3-d cathode of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Both polarization and impedance re-sults reveal that Cr impurities lead to serious performance degradation, especially in wet condition.
Titulo: Cr deposition and poisoning on SrCo0.9Ta0.1O3-d cathode of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Significant morphology damages occur after Cr exposure and the formation of SrCrO4 and Co3O4 secondary phases on the cathode surface are determined, which greatly deteriorates the oxygen reduction kinetics and thereby the cathode activity.
Titulo: Cr deposition and poisoning on SrCo0.9Ta0.1O3-d cathode of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Our study highlights that surface Sr segregation plays a vital role for Cr deposition and special attention should be paid for the practical applications in SOFC.(c) 2022 Hydrogen Energy Publications LLC.
Titulo: Cr deposition and poisoning on SrCo0.9Ta0.1O3-d cathode of solid oxide fuel cells
